name: biomni-get-rna-seq-archs4
title: Biomni: Get Rna Seq Archs4
description: Fetch RNA-seq expression data for a gene from the ARCHS4 database
content:
Overview

Fetches RNA-seq expression data for a specific gene from the ARCHS4 (All RNA-seq and ChIP-seq Sample and Signature Search) database, which contains uniformly processed expression data from hundreds of thousands of samples. This tool retrieves tissue-specific expression levels, enabling quick assessment of gene expression patterns across diverse biological contexts.

Input Parameters

  • gene_name (string): Gene symbol to query (e.g., TP53, BRCA1, MYC)
  • top_k (integer, optional): Number of top tissues/samples to return ranked by expression (default: 10)
  • output (string): Output directory path

Input Format

Provide a JSON file with the following structure:

{
  "gene_name": "TP53",
  "top_k": 20,
  "output": "/output/directory"
}

Biological Use Case

Essential for rapid expression profiling and hypothesis generation. Used to determine where genes are normally expressed, identify tissue-specific markers, prioritize tissues for experimental validation, compare expression across organs, and discover unexpected expression patterns that suggest novel functions.

Output

Generates rna_seq_results.txt containing expression values across tissues/samples, ranked by expression level, with sample metadata and statistical summaries.

Category

genomics
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python3 prod_apps/biomni/genomics/get_rna_seq_archs4.py "${inputFile}" -o "${outputDir}"
